page.title: 02Farming in the Bodenham area
page.content: There are sixteen farms in Bodenham. The total acreage is over 1,385 acres. No farms have a manager.The farms are: Rowberry Court,150 acres, owned and managed by Mr B.W.J.Linton, with 2 workers.There are 10 buildings some dating back 417 years. 14 people live there.He keeps cows, sheep, goats, wheat, barley, raspberries, potatoes. Gritt Farm, 64 acres, is owned by Mr M.O.N. Lewis an only worker.There are 8 buildings dating back 500 years. 5 people live there.They sell pigs, lambs and peas,wheat and barley. Gravel Farm,150 acres, is owned by Mr Pugh. There are 4 workers. The farm is 300 years old and has 10 buildings. He keeps milk and beef cattle sheep and fruit. Glebe Farm, 46 acres, owned by Mr G D Beven.There are 4 buildings dating back 500 years.There are 2 workers.
